duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide oversight of all accounting functions (accounts receivable, accounts payable, payroll, etc.) for a growing government contractor.
Responsible for Accounts Receivable, including new customer account set up, monthly billing, and payment collection.
Process Accounts Payable, including vendor setup, bill entry, and payment.
Ensure accuracy of entry and timely payment of all bills.
Review vendor invoice transactions, corporate credit cards, and employee expense reports to ensure compliance with prescribed procedures.
Oversee payroll and timesheet cycle, maintain related records, ensure reconciliation with payroll system and accounting system is complete.
Assist with month-end closing process, including preparation of supporting schedules, recording journal entries, balance sheet reconciliations, and monthly bank reconciliations.
Reconcile accounts and investigate any issues in Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, and labor accounts.
Support property tax filings and various state and local business tax items, as needed.
Research technical tax, audit, and accounting/cost issues as necessary.
Prepare quarterly financial package for executive and external review.
Coordinate and serve as primary point of contact during yearly audits with an outside firm.
Assist with the annual corporate tax process and send annual 1099’s to necessary vendors.
Use excel and data analytical skills to conduct in-depth analyses to identify, isolate, and resolve complex discrepancies.
Perform other accounting, financial, or administrative tasks as required by the Director of Finance or other.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or related field
